DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the texture type of a breast implant.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue._A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/11/2017: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A silicone gel-filled or saline-filled sac placed under the chest muscle to restore breast shape._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges.

Concepts.definition: Having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges or irregularities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A silicone gel-filled or saline-filled sac placed under the chest muscle to restore breast shape.

A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.
